revised_title: Effects of Chronic Stimulation on Isotonic Shortening Velocity of Denervated Rat Slow-Twitch Muscle
tldr: Researchers found that chronic stimulation of denervated rat slow-twitch muscles led to significant changes in their isotonic shortening velocity. The study showed that the stimulated muscles developed ten times more tension than unstimulated ones, and their twitch contraction and relaxation times were prolonged. The results suggest that muscle activity plays a crucial role in controlling its contractile properties.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
